chapter.title: Objects
chapter.para: As the protocol is REST-based the base elements of it are objects.

There are several types of objects:
product
A single program, library or package.
component
Part of program, library of package.
bug
A single problem.
comment
A comment about the bug.
attachment
A file attachment to bug.
person
A person (reporter, developer or administrator).

sect1.title: Elements common for all types of object
sect1.para: There are several properties and actions shared among the objects

sect2.title: Properties
sect2.para:
Each object has following properties:
uuid
The uuid number which identifies single object. The uuid MUST be unique. It MUST NOT change.
name
The human-readable name. The implementation SHOULD handle urlencoded form as an equivalent of uuid if it identifies the object (i.e. there are no duplicates of names).
link
It indicates to which server the object belongs to. It can occure in two cases:
The object is cached in server (for whatever reason) but the most current version is pointed by the uri of this property.
In this case the implementation MAY remove the object in this case in future to save the disk space.
or
The object has been moved in the specified address from this bug tracker.
The implementation MUST NOT remove the object from it's database.
In both cases the implementation MAY return the 302 (Found) return code.
The client SHOULD update its inner reference.
stored
Used with the link property. If it set to true it indicates that the object will be stored pernamently. If to false it may be removed in future.
history
It is a special object denoting the history. It SHOULD NOT be included in default response but after the /history action. It indicates the changes of the bug.
